name: Brisbane Lions 2001 Quiz | Brisbane Lions | 25 Questions

questions.text: In what year did the Brisbane Bears enter the VFL-AFL competition?
questions.explanation:
1987.

	Playing at Carrara on the Gold Coast back then.

questions.text: In what year did the merger between the Brisbane Bears and the Fitzroy Lions take place?
questions.explanation:
1996.

	4th July, 1996: the date of the first ever merger between two elite level sporting teams in Australia.

questions.text: How old was Michael Voss when he tied with James Hird for the Brownlow Medal?
questions.explanation:
21.

	Back in 1996 after playing only 76 games.

questions.text: What former Kangaroo was playing for the Lions in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Martin Pike & Pike.

	I'm pretty sure he has played every game for the Lions that year.

questions.text: What Lions defender quit abruptly, halfway through the 2000 season?
questions.explanation:
Adam Heuskes & Heuskes.

	He was one of the best defenders in the game (my opinion) when he quit the Lions.

questions.text: Who was Brisbane's number one ruckman for season 2001?
questions.explanation:
Clark Keating.

	Although Beau had a stellar season in 2000.

questions.text: In what year during the 1990s did the Lions finish 4th on the ladder?
questions.explanation:
1999.

	In 1999 they finished 4th, winning their last 10 games of the season before the finals series, after finishing last in 1998.

questions.text: Who was the coach of the Lions directly before (Lethal) Leigh Matthews took over?
questions.explanation:
Roger Merret.

	John Northey was the coach but was sacked halfway through the season and Roger Merret took over, and Lethal was appointed coach for the next season.

questions.text: What team did Brisbane trade Jarrod Molloy (the D9) with to pick up Mal Michael, prior to the start of 2001 season?
questions.explanation:
Collingwood.

	A good trade for both teams with both players having good seasons, and Brisbane needing a few good defenders after losing Lawrence (Saints), Heuskes and Champion (retirement).

questions.text: Brett Voss, brother of Brownlow Medallist Michael, was playing for which team in season 2001?
questions.explanation: St Kilda.

questions.text: What three colourful last names appeared on the Lions playing list in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Black, Brown, White.

	Simon Black, Jonathan Brown, Darryl White.

questions.text: What year did Leigh Matthews take over as coach of the Lions?
questions.explanation:
1999.

	Took them from wooden spoon to fourth in his first year.

questions.text: Which of these 4 Lions players had played the most games prior to the start of 2001 season?
questions.explanation:
Marcus Ashcroft.

	Ashcroft 243, Lynch 226, White 179, Voss 151.

questions.text: Which of these Lions had the most career goals prior to start of 2001 season?
questions.explanation:
Alastair Lynch.

	Lynch 383, Leppitsch 159, Voss 122, Bradshaw 110.

questions.text: In finishing 5th on the ladder for the 2000 season, what was Brisbane's win-loss ratio?
Since the merger, what was the Lion's highest total score for one game, prior to 2001 season?
questions.explanation:
28-13-181 Fremantle.

	I made up the Geelong score.

questions.text: Since the merger, what was the Lions lowest total score for one game, prior to 2001 season?
questions.explanation:
5-14-44 St Kilda.

	I made up 5-8-38, the actual lowest against Freemantle was 7-8-50.

questions.text: Simon Black is originally from what state?
questions.explanation: Western Australia.

questions.text: Who was the number one draft pick in 1998 (he was playing for the Lions in 2001)?
questions.explanation: Des Headland.

questions.text: Brisbane had three goalkickers with over fifty goals in the 2000 season, Alastair Lynch and Daniel Bradshaw are two of them, who was the third?
questions.explanation:
Luke Power & Power.

	Power had 52 goals for 10th overall in the competition, Bradshaw 56 and Lynch 68.

questions.text: Who won the club's Best and Fairest Player award in season 2000?
questions.explanation: Michael Voss.

questions.text: Brisbane never lost a finals game at the Gabba during the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Out of five they have won all five, but have lost all five finals played in Melbourne.

questions.text: Brisbane never won a finals game in Melbourne during the 1990s?
questions.explanation:
True.

	They lost all five finals played in Melbourne, until they broke their hoodoo in 2001.

questions.text: Prior to 2001 season (and since the merger), what team had Brisbane never beaten?
questions.explanation:
Essendon.

	In 2000 I sat at the Gabba in the pouring rain and watched Essendon belt us, But revenge is sweet and along with Carlton, the Lions are the only teams to have beaten Essendon at the half way point of the 2001 season proper (not including Ansett Cup).

questions.text: Name the Lions assistant coach who was a former Essendon player?
questions.explanation:
O'Donell & O'Donnell.

	Came to the club the same time as Lethal, and has been a big part of the Lions form turn around from 1998.
